Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Tradescantia prefers bright indirect light to direct light. Insufficient light will cause the foliage to fade.

Title: WATER
Description: Water your Tradescantia when the top 50%-75% of soil is dry. Water until liquid flows through the drainage hole at the bottom of the pot and discard any water that has accumulated in the saucer.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: Your bathroom or kitchen would be a great choice for your Tradescantia because it does best in a slightly more humid environment. Feel free to mist your plant frequently. If the humidity is too low the leaves will start to brown.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Tradescantia will do great in average room temperatures between 60-80°F.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed monthly in the spring through fall with a general-purpose indoor plant fertilizer diluted to half strength. Before applying fertilizer in any form, make sure the soil is damp.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Your Tradescantia is mildly toxic to humans and pets. Ingestion may cause mouth and stomach irritation.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Pinching back the long vines encourages branching and increases the fullness of the plant. To do this, simply ‘pinch’ off at a joint or at the tender new growth at the end of the stem.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Give your Oyster Plant indirect bright light to keep the bold colors. It can be in lower light but colors may fade to green.

Title: WATER
Description: Water your Oyster Plant when the top 50% of soil is dry. Water thoroughly until you see it flow out of the drainage hole. Be sure to discard excess water in the saucer to discourage root rot.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: The Oyster Plant prefers a somewhat humid environment. Mist often, use a pebble tray, or place a humidifier nearby.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: A normal room temperature between 60-80°F is perfect for your Rhoeo Oyster.

Title: FOOD
Description: During the growing season from spring to summer, fertilize your plant once a month with a general houseplant fertilizer diluted to half strength.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: The Oyster Plant is toxic if ingested by humans or pets. Handling can cause skin irritation, so wear gloves when pruning or repotting.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: As your Oyster Plant matures, it will produce pups. These can be taken out of the pot once their roots are established and planted in their own pot.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Give your Tradescantia Nanouk indirect bright light to keep the bold colors. It can be in lower light but colors will fade.

Title: WATER
Description: Water when the soil volume is 50% dry. Water thoroughly until you see it flow out of the drainage hole. Discard any excess water in the dish to discourage root rot.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: The Tradescantia Nanouk does well in average household humidity, but will like the occasional misting.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Tradescantia Nanouk prefers temperatures between 60-80°F.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed monthly in the spring through fall with a general-purpose indoor plant fertilizer diluted to half strength. Before applying fertilizer in any form, make sure the soil is damp.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: The Tradescantia Nanouk is toxic to humans and pets in ingested.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Pinching back the long vines encourages branching and increases the fullness of the plant. To do this, simply ‘pinch’ off at a joint or at the tender new growth at the end of the stem.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Tradescantia Zebrina prefers bright indirect light. Insufficient light will cause the vibrant striping on the leaves to fade.

Title: WATER
Description:
Water your Tradescantia Zebrina when the top 50%-75% of soil is dry. Water until liquid flows through the drainage hole at the bottom of the
pot and discard any water that has accumulated in the saucer.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: Your bathroom or kitchen would be a great choice for your Tradescantia Zebrina because it does best in a slightly more humid environment. Feel free to mist your plant frequently. If the humidity is too low the leaves will start to brown.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Tradescantia Zebrinas prefer average to warm temperatures of 55–80 degrees during the day and above 50 degrees at night.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a liquid fertilizer for indoor plants.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Your Tradescantia Zebrina is mildly toxic to humans and pets. Ingestion may cause mouth and stomach irritation.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Pinching back the long vines encourages branching and increases the fullness of the plant. To do this, simply ‘pinch’ off at a joint or at the tender new growth at the end of the stem.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Give your Tahitian Bridal Veil indirect bright light. This can be found in an eastern window or a few feet back from a southern or western window. It can tolerate lower light but it most likely will not flower during the warmer months and growth will slow.

Title: WATER
Description: Water when the soil volume is 50% dry. Water thoroughly until you see it flow out of the drainage hole. Discard any excess water in the dish to discourage root rot.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: The Tahitian Bridal Veil does well in average household humidity, but will like the occasional misting.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Tahitian Bridal Veil prefers temperatures between 55-80°F.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed monthly in the spring through fall with a general-purpose indoor plant fertilizer diluted to half strength. Before applying fertilizer in any form, make sure the soil is damp.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: The Tahitian Bridal Veil is toxic to humans and pets if ingested.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Pinching back the long vines encourages branching and increases the fullness of the plant. To do this, simply ‘pinch’ off a stem at a leaf joint, removing the tender new growth at the end of the stem. New growth will soon appear.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Kale plant requires bright light to full sun. If grown indoors, place on a sunny windowsill or under a grow light.

Title: WATER
Description: Water your Kale plant when the top 25% of soil is dry. Water until liquid flows through the drainage hole at the bottom of the pot and discard any water that has accumulated in the saucer. Do not allow the soil of your Kale plant to dry out completely.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: Your Kale plant prefers a humid environment. Mist often if grown indoors.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a fertilizer for edible plants.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Cut your Kale at any point to enjoy it. Cut no more than ⅓ of the plant’s leaves off at any given time. Please note: Kale is meant for humans, not pets.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Pepper Plant will grow best in full sun, but will also do just fine indoors on a sunny windowsill, as long as it receives at least 6-8 hours of direct sun per day.

Title: WATER
Description: Do not allow the soil of your Pepper Plant to dry out completely. Water when the top 50% of soil is dry. If kept outside during peak growth in the spring and summer, watering may be needed every day.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: If kept indoors, mist a few times per week.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Pepper Plant will do best in temperatures between 60-90 degrees. If kept outdoors, bring indoors before nighttime temperatures dip below 50 degrees.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a fertilizer for edible plants.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Cubanelle and Sweet Banana Peppers are non-toxic and edible, but are meant to be eaten by humans — not pets. Green Bell Peppers are non-toxic to pets.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description:
Pick your Peppers when they begin turning color. Cubanelle Peppers are ready once red in color; Green Bell Peppers are ready once green in color; and Sweet Banana Pepper are ready once yellow-green in color.
Enjoy by themselves or add them to a variety of dishes.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Tomato plant will grow best in full sun, but will also do just fine indoors on a sunny windowsill, as long as it receives at least 6-8 hours of direct sun per day.

Title: WATER
Description: Do not allow the soil of your Tomato plant to dry out completely. Water when the top 50% of soil is dry. During peak growth in the spring and summer, watering may be needed every day.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: If kept indoors, mist a few times per week.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Tomato plant will do best in temperatures between 60-90 degrees. If kept outdoors, bring indoors before nighttime temperatures dip below 50 degrees.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a fertilizer for edible plants.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Pick your Tomatoes when they turn from green to red in color. They can also be picked when still green and left to ripen off the vine.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Tomatoes are non-toxic and edible. The stems and leaves are considered to be toxic in large amounts and should not be eaten.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your Yucca prefers bright indirect light indirect to bright light. Too little light will cause growth to slow.

Title: WATER
Description:
Water your Yucca when 75-100% of the soil volume is dry. Water until liquid flows through the
drainage hole at the bottom of the pot and discard any water that has accumulated in the saucer.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: Your Yucca Cane does not require any extra humidity, but will appreciate an occasional misting.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Yucca Cane prefers temperatures between 65°-85° F.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a liquid fertilizer for indoor plants.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Yucca Plants are mildly toxic to pets and humans if ingested.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: You may see “pups” popping up off the side of the mother cane at the soil level. These can provide you with more Yucca plants. If you wish to plant the mature pups, only do so in the Fall–this does the least amount of damage to the original plant. Remove the mature dark green pup (pale and whitish pups need more time on the mother cane) with a clean, sharp cut between the parent plant and the pup. Make sure to take some of the parent roots where the pup is attached, along with the pup.  This root piece from the parent will form the new root system for the pup once it is placed in fresh potting soil. Water thoroughly and apply a diluted application of fertilizer.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your zebra plant thrives in bright, indirect light. It can tolerate a couple of hours of direct morning sunlight, but avoid long periods of direct sun and especially direct afternoon sun, which can cause the leaves to scorch. Zebra plants are not adaptable to low light.

Title: WATER
Description: Water your zebra plant when the top 25% of soil is dry. Water thoroughly, and be sure to empty the saucer of any excess water to prevent root rot. Avoid watering directly on the leaves, as water can funnel down the stems and cause crown rot.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: Your zebra plant requires a high humidity level of 60-70%. In lower humidity environments, the leaf edges will brown, new leaves may not develop properly, and the plant will not thrive. Group plants together to create a humid microclimate, place a humidifier nearby, or use a pebble tray to raise the humidity. Keep the plant away from air vents, which can be drying. A large humidity dome with a vent may be helpful.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your zebra plant prefers temperatures at 65°F and above to thrive. Avoid cold drafts and sudden temperature changes.

Title: FOOD
Description: For best results, use a liquid houseplant fertilizer diluted to half the recommended strength once every 1-2 weeks during the spring and summer. Never apply fertilizer to dry soil; always make sure the soil is damp before feeding your plant.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: Your zebra plant is considered to be non-toxic to pets and humans.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description:
Though the zebra plant is considered non-toxic, the sap can irritate sensitive skin, so we recommend wearing gloves when handling this plant.
Under the right conditions, your zebra plant may produce multiple flower spikes. The showy, bright yellow flowers are actually called bracts, a type of modified leaf structure, and can remain on the plant for up to 6 weeks. When the bracts start to brown, just cut the stem down as close to the base of the plant as possible. Your plant will go into a resting period after flowering, during which it will use less water. You should also pause fertilizing during this resting period until you see new leaf growth.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Your ZZ plant prefers indirect bright light. It will tolerate low light and can even adapt to fluorescent lighting, but growth will slow. Avoid extended exposure to direct sunlight, which can scorch the foliage.

Title: WATER
Description: Wateronly when the soil volume is completely dry. Water until liquid flows through the drainage hole at the bottom of the pot and discard any water that accumulates in the saucer.

Title: HUMIDITY
Description: This plant does fine in average household humidity.

Title: TEMPERATURE
Description: Your Raven ZZ Plant prefers temperatures between 60-75°F. Keep away from drafts and air vents, especially during the winter months.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once in the spring and once in the summer with anall-purpose fertilizerfor indoor plants. Do not apply fertilizer on dry soil.

Title: TOXICITY
Description: This plant is considered toxic to pets and humans if ingested.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: The ZZ Plant has evolved to survive extreme drought, so feel free to go a little longer between waterings. Bright yellow leaves are a sign the soil is staying too wet, and drooping or dropping leaves are a sign the plant needs to be watered. Clean the leaves with a soft cloth ordusting glovesand water to maintain the Raven ZZ’s signature glossy black look.

Title: LIGHT
Description:
Your Zenzi Plant prefers medium to bright indirect light, but it is extremely adaptable. It will tolerate
low light and fluorescent lighting in a windowless space.

Title: WATER
Description:
Water your Zenzi Plant only when the soil is completely dry. Water until liquid flows through the
drainage hole at the bottom of the pot and discard any water that has accumulated in the saucer.

Title: LIGHT
Description: This plant does not require any extra humidity.

Title: FOOD
Description: Feed once every month during the spring and summer with a liquid fertilizer for indoor plants.

Title: LIGHT
Description: Zenzi Plants are mildly toxic to pets and humans. Typically, ingestion will cause mouth and stomach irritation and possible vomiting.

Title: ADDITIONAL CARE
Description: Your Zenzi likes to be pot bound so repotting will not need to be done for quite some time. As a survival technique, the Zenzi Plant has evolved to start dropping its leaflets to conserve moisture during periods of severe drought. If you forget to water yours and see the leaves fall off, don’t give up hope! Water your plant immediately and it should come back. Yellow leaves can indicate overwatering.
